message.content: This question requires some knowledge about the adaptation techniques used by animals to avoid being detected by predators. When a bird sits still and blends in with its surroundings, it is utilizing a technique called merging with the background. By doing so, the bird becomes less noticeable to the cat, making it harder for the cat to detect and catch the bird. Options (A), (C), and (D) are unrelated and do not describe any adaptive behavior used by birds.
